content: making waves yayalovestoknit october 4 2016 a quick to knit hat that features a rib stitch variation for a fun wavy texture size child to teen the sample hat measures 9 from top to bottom and 15 around the bottom band without any blocking the hat is stretchy and generously fits the 23 head of the mannequin head shown to the left yarn worsted weight yarn the sample hat was knit using 68 grams 121 8 yds of premier yarns deborah norville s everyday soft worsted solid 100% acrylic 113 grams/203 yards per skein needles us 06 and us 07 circular needles plus us 07 double pointed needles other tools stitch marker tapestry/darning needle gauge 18 sts x 24 rounds = 4 abbreviations used k= knit k2tog = knit two stitches together p = purl p2tog = purl two stitches together psso = pass slip_stitch over sl = slip_stitch as if to purl st s = stitch es note it will be necessary to adjust the position of the marker once during the decreases in the crown of the hat see step 7 in the decrease section begin pattern using the us 06 circular needle cast on 90 sts taking care to not twist the stitches join to begin knitting in the round place marker to indicate the beginning of round bottom band k1 p1 around repeat until band measures 2 from cast-on edge body of hat changing to us 07 circular needles knit the following 8-round pattern repeat 5 times or until the hat measures 7 to 7-½ from the cast-on edge ending with round 8 rounds 1-4 k4 p2 around rounds 5-8 k1 p2 k3 around for a slouchier fit knit additional repeats crown of hat decreases when the number of stitches become too few to work comfortably on the circular needle change to double pointed needles 1 k4 p2 around 2 repeat step 1 3 k1 k2tog k1 p2tog around 30 sts decreased 60 sts remain 4 k3 p1 around 5 k1 p1 k3 repeat instruction between until 3 sts remain p1 k2 6 repeat step 5 7 k1 p1 sl1 k2tog psso repeat instruction between until 3 sts remain p1 sl2 remove marker move last stitch slipped from right needle to left needle knit this stitch together with next stitch on left needle place marker your marker has moved over 1 st to the left 8 p1 k1 9 repeat step 8 10 k2tog around 15 sts remain 11 k2tog until 1 st remains k1 8 sts remain finishing cut the yarn leaving at least a 12 yarn end using the darning needle thread the yarn through the remaining 8 stitches at least twice cinch snugly and anchor the yarn weave in the yarn ends steam or block the hat if desired
